appendix.title: Australian Water Resources Information System
appendix.para: Within the Water Regulations 2008, 10 categories (and 105 subcategories) of Water Information are identified. This data is to be provided to the Bureau of Meteorology for storing in AWRIS. These 10 categories are:

listitem.para: Category 1 - Surface water resource information (including streamflow data);
Category 2 – Groundwater resource information;
Category 3 – Water storage information;
Category 4 – Meteorological information (including rainfall data);
Category 5 – Water use information;
Category 6 – Information about water rights, allocations and trades;
Category 7 – Information about urban water management;
Category 8 – Information about water restrictions;
Category 9 – Water quality information;
Category 11 – Water information for flood warning purposes; and
Meta-data and contextual information about water information in other categories (note: this was originally Category 10).

appendix.para: The meta-data and contextual information refers to information that was intended to help the Bureau of Meteorology and others to contextualise the data. In general, the meta-data and contextual information includes:

listitem.para: Rating tables for watercourses;
Capacity tables for storages;
Descriptions of water access entitlements; and
Descriptions of water access entitlements

appendix.para: The Water Regulations 2008 also contains specific details as to the meta-data to be provided with each Sub-category for storing in AWRIS. The meta-data specified for streamflow and rainfall data are provided below:

listitem.para: Sub-category 1a - Level of water course expressed in metres
The vertical datum applicable to the observation;
Time and date of the observation;

Tables that enable the derivation of volumetric discharge from water level or stage height – the complete historical sequence of rating tables, indicating the time span across which the rating should apply;
Other meta-data and contextual information; and
Manuals or protocols that describe procedures used in measuring, managing or interpreting water information.
Sub-category 1b – Discharge of a water course expressed in cumecs
Time and date of the observation;

Tables that enable the derivation of volumetric discharge from water level or stage height – the complete historical sequence of rating tables, indicating the time span across which the rating should apply;
Other meta-data and contextual information; and
Manuals or protocols that describe procedures used in measuring, managing or interpreting water information.
Category 4a – Accumulated precipitation, including the water-equivalent precipitation depth expressed in millimetres
Specified time interval of the observation;
Time and date of the observation;
Other meta-data and contextual information; and
Manuals or protocols that describe procedures used in measuring, managing or interpreting water information.
